actions.name: Update Row in Table
actions.title: Update hit counts (shift window)+insert last PolicySet hitcounts

properties.display_name: Update hit counts (shift window)+insert last PolicySet hitcounts

properties.script:
import sys

arr = [int(sys.argv[1]),int(sys.argv[2]), int(sys.argv[3]), int(sys.argv[4]), int(sys.argv[5]), int(sys.argv[6]), int(sys.argv[7]), int(sys.argv[8]), int(sys.argv[9]), int(sys.argv[10]), int(sys.argv[11]), int(sys.argv[12]), int(sys.argv[13]), int(sys.argv[14]), int(sys.argv[15]), int(sys.argv[16]), int(sys.argv[17]), int(sys.argv[18]), int(sys.argv[19]), int(sys.argv[20]), int(sys.argv[21]), int(sys.argv[22]), int(sys.argv[23]), int(sys.argv[24]), int(sys.argv[25])]
window_size = 15

i = 0
# Initialize an empty list to store moving averages
moving_averages = []

# Loop through the array to consider

while i < len(arr) - window_size + 1:

  # Store elements from i to i+window_size
  # in list to get the current window
  window = arr[i : i + window_size]

  # Calculate the average of current window
  window_average = round(sum(window) / window_size, 2)
  
  # Store the average of current
  # window in moving average list
  moving_averages.append(window_average)
  
  # Shift window to right by one position
  i += 1

averages = int(round(sum(moving_averages)/len(moving_averages), 2))

authC_increase = int((round((arr[-1] - averages)/arr[-1], 2)) * 100)

authC_delta = int(sys.argv[25]) - int(sys.argv[24])

properties.script:
import sys
import json

# Parse JSON data
data = json.loads(sys.argv[1])

# Extract userName values and insert them into a set to remove duplicates
user_names = set(failure["userName"] for failure in data["failures"])

# Convert the set to a list
user_names_list = list(user_names)

This strongly suggests an ongoing Password Spraying Attack targeting the monitored environment.
